class.name: EntityInformationFamilyPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.3. Common superclass for EntityState, Collision, collision-elastic, and entity state update PDUs.

class.name: EntityStatePdu
class.comment: 7.2.2. Represents the postion and state of one entity in the world. See 5.3.2.

attribute.name: entityID
attribute.comment: Unique ID for an entity that is tied to this state information

attribute.name: forceId
attribute.comment: What force this entity is affiliated with, eg red, blue, neutral, etc

attribute.name: numberOfVariableParameters
attribute.comment: How many variable parameters are in the variable length list. In earlier versions of DIS these were known as articulation parameters

attribute.name: entityType
attribute.comment: Describes the type of entity in the world

attribute.name: entityLinearVelocity
attribute.comment: Describes the speed of the entity in the world

attribute.name: entityLocation
attribute.comment: describes the location of the entity in the world

attribute.name: entityOrientation
attribute.comment: describes the orientation of the entity, in euler angles

attribute.name: entityAppearance
attribute.comment: a series of bit flags that are used to help draw the entity, such as smoking, on fire, etc.

attribute.name: deadReckoningParameters
attribute.comment: parameters used for dead reckoning

attribute.name: marking
attribute.comment: characters that can be used for debugging, or to draw unique strings on the side of entities in the world

attribute.name: capabilities
attribute.comment: a series of bit flags

attribute.name: variableParameters
attribute.comment: variable length list of variable parameters. In earlier DIS versions this was articulation parameters.

class.name: FastEntityStatePdu
class.comment: Represents the postion and state of one entity in the world. This is identical in function to entity state pdu, but generates less garbage to collect in the Java world. Section 7.2.2.

attribute.name: site
attribute.comment: The site ID

attribute.name: application
attribute.comment: The application ID

attribute.name: entity
attribute.comment: the entity ID

attribute.name: forceId
attribute.comment: what force this entity is affiliated with, eg red, blue, neutral, etc

attribute.name: numberOfVariableParameters
attribute.comment: How many variable (nee articulation) parameters are in the variable length list

attribute.name: entityKind
attribute.comment: Kind of entity

attribute.name: domain
attribute.comment: Domain of entity (air, surface, subsurface, space, etc)

attribute.name: country
attribute.comment: country to which the design of the entity is attributed

attribute.name: category
attribute.comment: category of entity

attribute.name: subcategory
attribute.comment: subcategory of entity

attribute.name: specific
attribute.comment: specific info based on subcategory field

attribute.name: altEntityKind
attribute.comment: Kind of entity

attribute.name: altDomain
attribute.comment: Domain of entity (air, surface, subsurface, space, etc)

attribute.name: altCountry
attribute.comment: country to which the design of the entity is attributed

attribute.name: altCategory
attribute.comment: category of entity

attribute.name: altSubcategory
attribute.comment: subcategory of entity

attribute.name: altSpecific
attribute.comment: specific info based on subcategory field

attribute.name: xVelocity
attribute.comment: X velo

attribute.name: yVelocity
attribute.comment: y Value

attribute.name: zVelocity
attribute.comment: Z value

attribute.name: xLocation
attribute.comment: X value

attribute.name: yLocation
attribute.comment: y Value

attribute.name: zLocation
attribute.comment: Z value

attribute.name: entityAppearance
attribute.comment: a series of bit flags that are used to help draw the entity, such as smoking, on fire, etc.

attribute.name: deadReckoningAlgorithm
attribute.comment: enumeration of what dead reckoning algorighm to use

attribute.name: otherParameters
attribute.comment: other parameters to use in the dead reckoning algorithm

attribute.name: xAcceleration
attribute.comment: X value

attribute.name: yAcceleration
attribute.comment: y Value

attribute.name: zAcceleration
attribute.comment: Z value

attribute.name: xAngularVelocity
attribute.comment: X value

attribute.name: yAngularVelocity
attribute.comment: y Value

attribute.name: zAngularVelocity
attribute.comment: Z value

attribute.name: marking
attribute.comment: characters that can be used for debugging, or to draw unique strings on the side of entities in the world

attribute.name: capabilities
attribute.comment: a series of bit flags

attribute.name: variableParameters
attribute.comment: variable length list of variable parameters. In earlier versions of DIS these were known as articulation parameters

class.name: CollisionPdu
class.comment: 7.2.3 Collisions between entities shall be communicated by issuing a Collision PDU. See 5.3.3.

attribute.name: issuingEntityID
attribute.comment: This field shall identify the entity that is issuing the PDU, and shall be represented by an Entity Identifier record (see 6.2.28).

attribute.name: collidingEntityID
attribute.comment: This field shall identify the entity that has collided with the issuing entity (see 5.3.3.4). This field shall be represented by an Entity Identifier record (see 6.2.28).

attribute.name: eventID
attribute.comment: This field shall contain an identification generated by the issuing simulation application to associate related collision events. This field shall be represented by an Event Identifier record (see 6.2.34).

attribute.name: collisionType
attribute.comment: This field shall identify the type of collision. The Collision Type field shall be represented by an 8-bit record of enumerations

attribute.name: pad
attribute.comment: some padding

attribute.name: velocity
attribute.comment: This field shall contain the velocity (at the time the collision is detected) of the issuing entity. The velocity shall be represented in world coordinates. This field shall be represented by the Linear Velocity Vector record [see 6.2.95 item c)].

attribute.name: mass
attribute.comment: This field shall contain the mass of the issuing entity, and shall be represented by a 32-bit floating point number representing kilograms.

attribute.name: location
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the location of the collision with respect to the entity with which the issuing entity collided. The Location field shall be represented by an Entity Coordinate Vector record [see 6.2.95 item a)].

class.name: CollisionElasticPdu
class.comment: 7.2.4 Information about elastic collisions in a DIS exercise shall be communicated using a Collision-Elastic PDU. See 5.3.4.

attribute.name: issuingEntityID
attribute.comment: This field shall identify the entity that is issuing the PDU and shall be represented by an Entity Identifier record (see 6.2.28)

attribute.name: collidingEntityID
attribute.comment: This field shall identify the entity that has collided with the issuing entity. This field shall be a valid identifier of an entity or server capable of responding to the receipt of this Collision-Elastic PDU. This field shall be represented by an Entity Identifier record (see 6.2.28).

attribute.name: collisionEventID
attribute.comment: This field shall contain an identification generated by the issuing simulation application to associate related collision events. This field shall be represented by an Event Identifier record (see 6.2.34).

attribute.name: pad
attribute.comment: some padding

attribute.name: contactVelocity
attribute.comment: This field shall contain the velocity at the time the collision is detected at the point the collision is detected. The velocity shall be represented in world coordinates. This field shall be represented by the Linear Velocity Vector record [see 6.2.95 item c)]

attribute.name: mass
attribute.comment: This field shall contain the mass of the issuing entity and shall be represented by a 32-bit floating point number representing kilograms

attribute.name: locationOfImpact
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the location of the collision with respect to the entity with which the issuing entity collided. This field shall be represented by an Entity Coordinate Vector record [see 6.2.95 item a)].

attribute.name: collisionIntermediateResultXX
attribute.comment: These six records represent the six independent components of a positive semi-definite matrix formed by pre-multiplying and post-multiplying the tensor of inertia, by the anti-symmetric matrix generated by the moment arm, and shall be represented by 32-bit floating point numbers (see 5.3.4.4)

attribute.name: collisionIntermediateResultXY
attribute.comment: tensor values

attribute.name: collisionIntermediateResultXZ
attribute.comment: tensor values

attribute.name: collisionIntermediateResultYY
attribute.comment: tensor values

attribute.name: collisionIntermediateResultYZ
attribute.comment: tensor values

attribute.name: collisionIntermediateResultZZ
attribute.comment: tensor values

attribute.name: unitSurfaceNormal
attribute.comment: This record shall represent the normal vector to the surface at the point of collision detection. The surface normal shall be represented in world coordinates. This field shall be represented by an Entity Coordinate Vector record [see 6.2.95 item a)].

attribute.name: coefficientOfRestitution
attribute.comment: This field shall represent the degree to which energy is conserved in a collision and shall be represented by a 32-bit floating point number. In addition, it represents a free parameter by which simulation application developers may "tune" their collision interactions.

class.name: EntityStateUpdatePdu
class.comment: 7.2.5. Nonstatic information about a particular entity may be communicated by issuing an Entity State Update PDU. 5.3.5.

attribute.name: entityID
attribute.comment: This field shall identify the entity issuing the PDU, and shall be represented by an Entity Identifier record (see 6.2.28).

attribute.name: numberOfVariableParameters
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the number of variable parameters present. This field shall be represented by an 8-bit unsigned integer (see Annex I).

attribute.name: entityLinearVelocity
attribute.comment: This field shall specify an entity's linear velocity. The coordinate system for an entity's linear velocity depends on the dead reckoning algorithm used. This field shall be represented by a Linear Velocity Vector record [see 6.2.95 item c)]).

attribute.name: entityLocation
attribute.comment: This field shall specify an entity's physical location in the simulated world and shall be represented by a World Coordinates record (see 6.2.97).

attribute.name: entityOrientation
attribute.comment: This field shall specify an entity's orientation and shall be represented by an Euler Angles record (see 6.2.33).

attribute.name: entityAppearance
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the dynamic changes to the entity's appearance attributes. This field shall be represented by an Entity Appearance record (see 6.2.26).

attribute.name: variableParameters
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the parameter values for each Variable Parameter record that is included (see 6.2.93 and Annex I).

class.name: AttributePdu
class.comment: 7.2.6. Information about individual attributes for a particular entity, other object, or event may be communicated using an Attribute PDU. The Attribute PDU shall not be used to exchange data available in any other PDU except where explicitly mentioned in the PDU issuance instructions within this standard.. See 5.3.6.

attribute.name: originatingSimulationAddress
attribute.comment: This field shall identify the simulation issuing the Attribute PDU. It shall be represented by a Simulation Address record (see 6.2.79).

attribute.name: attributeRecordPduType
attribute.comment: This field shall represent the type of the PDU that is being extended or updated, if applicable. It shall be represented by an 8-bit enumeration.

attribute.name: attributeRecordProtocolVersion
attribute.comment: This field shall indicate the Protocol Version associated with the Attribute Record PDU Type. It shall be represented by an 8-bit enumeration.

attribute.name: masterAttributeRecordType
attribute.comment: This field shall contain the Attribute record type of the Attribute records in the PDU if they all have the same Attribute record type. It shall be represented by a 32-bit enumeration.

attribute.name: actionCode
attribute.comment: This field shall identify the action code applicable to this Attribute PDU. The Action Code shall apply to all Attribute records contained in the PDU. It shall be represented by an 8-bit enumeration.

attribute.name: numberAttributeRecordSet
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the number of Attribute Record Sets that make up the remainder of the PDU. It shall be represented by a 16-bit unsigned integer.
